pros: Great coworkers and a small hospital
cons: I can not think of any

pros: Teamwork is the motto... everyone helps out. The staff is great and it’s a good place to work.
cons: Small hospital so pay is lower

pros: tuition assistance, as much overtime as you desire

job_title: Patient Financial Advocate in Newton, KS
pros: Very flexible hours, growth opportunities, good benefits.
cons: Low pay, workplace favoritism, employees frequently calling in sick/leaving early creating a higher work load for others.

job_title: Food and Nutrition Worker in Newton, KS
pros: good pay, great supervisor, room to move up in company
cons: short-staffed, high turnover rate, have to work holidays.

review_title: A fish out of water should not be thrown into a lake.
pros:
Small facility so many department personnel knew each other.
Small community
cons: From the first day I was warned about the department director making life miserable for anyone she does not like. I should have taken that as a red flag then. The nurses on the floor thought they were above those with less experienced or education than them.

pros: Self-scheduling, flexible hours, opportunities to practice nursing skills under supervision of an RN, management is present on the floor.
cons: Understaffed - sometimes I will be the only aide with a 20 patient load. Since it's a small hospital, staff tends to get pretty "cliquey".  PRN staff are not eligible for benefits.

review_title: Very flexible schedule. Great for students. Not the best pay,
cons: Low pay, no growth (besides a yearly 10 cent raise IF you get 4/5 on every category on your review), will sometimes assign you to a position you have never been trained on

review_title: Living to Work not Working to Live
job_title: Human Resources Manager in Newton, KS
pros: An employer who understands the difference between listening to understand versus listening to defend
cons: None I have had nothing but positive experiences

pros: Work/life balance. Never work more than 40 hours a week.
cons: The nepotism in this hospital is ridiculous. Sharing the last name of the CEO will get you anything you want whenever you want and you're never held accountable. Destroys morale for everyone else. Upper management is well aware but everyone is too afraid to speak up. There is no room for growth. There is no respect unless you're a middle-aged white male.

review_title: Can be a good place to work (some days)
cons: Some inexperienced nurses you act like know it alls

pros: Wonderful, genuine people. Patient care was excellent.
cons: Hard to advance in work place.
